intro: Fumaria affinis, commonly known as the common fumitory, is a flowering plant in the family Fumariaceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Fumaria affinis is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats.
